sentences.en: And not just getting up for a sandwich -- eating from tubs of margarine or eating cigarettes and raw meat.
sentences.cn: 这可不仅 仅是起床拿一块三明治那么简单，而是吃大块的黄油或者香烟还有生肉。

sentences.en: As a hangover from rationing, they mixed butter and margarine.
sentences.cn: 作为食品配给制的一种遗留影响，他们总把黄油和人造黄油混在一起吃。
黄油和人造黄油都是脂肪.

sentences.en: Butter, margarine, and oily fish are all good sources of vitamin D.
sentences.cn: 黄油、人造黄油和多脂鱼都含有丰富的维生素D。

sentences.en: Cream the margarine in a small bowl, then sieve the icing sugar into it.
sentences.cn: 将人造黄油在小碗里搅成糊状，再将糖粉筛进去。

sentences.en: Cream together the margarine and sugar with a wooden spoon until light and fluffy.
sentences.cn: 用一只木勺把人造黄油和糖搅拌成稀松的糊状。

sentences.en: Foods that contain only medium levels of sodium are bread, cakes, milk, butter and margarine.
sentences.cn: 含钠量仅为中等水平的食物有面包、蛋糕、牛奶、黄油和人造黄油。

sentences.en: Margarine is derived from vegetable oil.
sentences.cn: 人造奶油来源于植物油.

sentences.en: Melt the margarine in a frying pan.
sentences.cn: 把人造黄油放在煎锅里溶化.

sentences.en: One in ten said they preferred their old brand of margarine.
sentences.cn: 有十分之一的人说比较喜欢老牌子的人造黄油.

sentences.en: Palm oil is an ingredient in an estimate third of all products on supermarket shelves, from biscuits and margarine to shampoo and confectionery.
sentences.cn: 在超市货架上，棕榈油是一种被估计使用率第三的食品配料，从饼干、人造黄油到洗发水到糖果都有它的足迹。

sentences.en: Polyunsaturated margarine is very popular now.
sentences.cn: 含有多重不饱和化合物的人造黄油现已很受欢迎.

sentences.en: Rancid butter and margarine are notorious.
sentences.cn: 哈喇奶油和人造奶油的难闻气味是众所周知的.

sentences.en: Sunflower margarine has the same fat content as butter.
sentences.cn: 向日葵所制人造黄油的脂肪含量与黄油脂肪含量相同。

sentences.en: There were few provisions available in exchange for food stamps: ersatz coffee, macaroni, small cubes of margarine.
sentences.cn: 可以用来换取粮票的食物只有这些：代用咖啡、通心粉和小块的人造黄油。

sentences.en: We substitute margarine for cream because cream is fattening.
sentences.cn: 我们用人造黄油代替奶油,因为奶油会使人发胖.

sentences.en: You can substitute margarine for butter.
sentences.cn: 你可以用人造奶油代替奶油.

trans.tran_en: a yellow substance similar to butter but made from vegetable or animal fats, which you eat with bread or use for cooking
